required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kinesiotaping Therapy for Clavicular Fractures FRACTURES:
clinical_study.official_title: An Alternative Conservative Treatment Method For Midshaft Clavicular Fractures: Kinesiotaping Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization

clinical_study.source: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multicenter prospective randomized controlled study. Forty patients in whom conservative treatment for clavicle midshaft fractures was indicated between January 2018 and July 2019 were included.
The investigators aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of the kinesiotaping technique for the conservative treatment of clavicle midshaft fractures. The investigators hypothesized that kinesiotaping reduces the disadvantages of conservative treatment, such as early-phase pain, high nonunion rates, and a prolonged time to return to work, and yields better clinical and functional outcomes by providing good mechanical support and neutralizing the deforming muscle forces around the fractured clavicle.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators divided into 2 groups and followed one group of patients with clavicle fractures only with shoulder sling, while the other group were followed with kinesiotherapy treatment and shoulder arm sling. They investigated the effect of kinesiotherapy treatment on early pain and returning time to work.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the two groups in terms of early return to work
primary_outcome.description: The investigators aim is to examine the effect of kinesiotaping treatment on clavicle fracture union.

arm_group.description: Participants used only arm sling for clavicula fracture

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm sling with kinesiotaping therapy group (group K).
arm_group.description: Participants used arm sling and the investigators applied kinesiotheraphy for clavicula fracture

intervention.description: The investigators used kinesiotaping strips in formations such as the Y, I, X, fan, web, and donut formations ove fractured clavicula.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm sling with kinesiotaping therapy group (group K).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants with midclavicle fracture within 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
Participants with open fractures,

facility.name: SBU Prof. Cemil Tascioglu City Hospital
